Dear Mr. McKeage:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Several days prior to the nurse practitioner arriving at the facility,
youth injured her ankle doing a cartwheel. Youth was given
crutches and Motrin. On 3/23/23 youth was examined and on
3/29/23 x-ray results indicated a severe fracture and there are
concerns that the injury is not consistent with the explanation.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on April 19, 2023,
by the MDHHS worker. Complainant explained Youth A’s fracture
is more common among gymnast who land hard on their feet
resulting with the impact causing a fracture that goes up the tibia.
Complainant said she has never seen this type of fracture solely
from a cartwheel. Complainant stated she had been of the
understanding that Youth A was on crutches since the accident
and when told that Youth A had been walking on her foot, she said
that could have exacerbated the fracture however she could not
be certain. Complainant said her main concern was the length of
time it took for Youth A to be seen by medical professional.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on March 30, 2023,
and via TEAMS on April 6, 2023, in collaboration with the
MDHHS worker. Youth A reported on both March 30, 2023, and
April 6, 2023, that her injury was from “landing a cartwheel wrong”
while on the pod and denied any staff hurting her or being
involved in her injury in anyway. Youth A said “most” of her peers
witnessed her injury as well as Staff 2. Youth A said on Sunday,
March 19, 2023, she was dancing on her pod and decided to do a
cartwheel and when she landed her ankle went in and she fell to
the ground. Youth A said immediately after she landed her ankle
began to swell up on the outside and she reported being in pain.
Youth A said she told Staff 2, and he called Supervisor D to the
pod. Youth A said Supervisor D looked at her ankle and gave her
ice and ibuprofen. Youth A said she submitted a medical slip to
see the nurse that day. Youth A said she “hopped around” the
2

remainder of the day since it hurt to put any pressure on her foot.
Youth A said the next morning Staff 1 was working and gave her
crutches to assist her in walking. Youth A said she saw Nurse and
Nurse Practitioner on Thursday, March 23, 2023, and was told she
needed to have an x-ray of her ankle and continue using crutches.
Youth A said her ankle turned black and blue so she asked Staff 2
and Nurse when she would get the x-ray completed and she was
always told they did not know. Youth A said she had the x-ray
done on Wednesday, March 29, 2023, and found out she had a
Salter Harris 4 fracture which started in her growth plate and went
up her tibia. Youth A said she also went and had a CT scan
completed on March 29, 2023, and then saw an orthopedic doctor
on April 5, 2023. Youth A said she has been given a wheelchair
since she was not able to use the crutches very well. Youth A said
she has been given ibuprofen and ice by staff daily as she
requests.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on April
13, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B
said she is on the same pod at Youth A and witnessed her injury.
Youth B said on Sunday, March 19, 2023, the youth were “playing
around” on the pod and Youth A did a cartwheel and landed
wrong and her ankle went “in” and was injured. Youth B said
Youth A said “ow” and then all youth told Staff 2 and Supervisor D.
Youth B said Youth A’s ankle was swollen on the top and began to
bruise on the top and sides. Youth B said Youth A was given ice,
and staff said they were not going to take her to the doctor that
day. Youth B said the next day Staff 1 gave Youth A crutches to
use but she did not always use them and would just “hop around”
instead. Youth B said Youth A had to wait until Thursday to see
the nurse and then needed an x-ray which she did not have until
the following Wednesday. Youth B said Youth A has had a
wheelchair since the day of the x-ray.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on April
13, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth C
said she is on the same pod at Youth A and witnessed her injury
her ankle. Youth C said on Sunday, March 19, 2023, all the youth
were “playing around” on the pod and Youth A did a cartwheel and
landed wrong. Youth C said Youth A’s ankle began to swell up
and bruise right away. Youth C said the swelling was “high up” on
Youth A’s ankle and Youth C thought it was broken right away.
Youth C said Staff 1 and Staff 2 gave Youth A ice and ibuprofen
but told her they “couldn’t do anything else” for her. Youth C said
Supervisor D came to the pod and said he could not send Youth A
to the doctor because there was “no extra staff”. Youth C said
3

Youth A was given crutches to use but she had a hard time with
them so stopped using them. Youth C said Youth A did not see
the nurse until Thursday and then did not get her x-ray until the
following Wednesday. Youth C said her and the other youth on the
pod have been helping Youth A get around and she is now in a
wheelchair.
Nurse was interviewed via TEAMS at the facility, on April 6,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Nurse said she
is contracted to work at Bay Pines Center for a half-day on
Monday, full day on Tuesday, half-day on Wednesday, and full
day on Thursday. Nurse said when a youth is injured the staff put
in a “medical slip” to her and she places the youth on the schedule
to see Nurse Practitioner on Thursdays. Nurse said if a youth has
an immediate need to be seen the staff are to call the triage line,
go to a walk-in clinic, or the emergency room. Nurse said after
clinic on Thursday’s she completes a medical form that includes
all upcoming appointments that are schedule as well as any
medical issue that needs follow-up. Nurse said she makes a copy
of the medical form and gives it directly to the supervisor on shift,
program manager, and Director as well as gives a copy to the
Administrative Assistant who emails it out to all supervisors, group
leaders, program manager, and Director. Nurse said all staff at
Bay Pines have been trained that x-rays need to be completed
within 24-48 hours of being ordered by Nurse Practitioner. Nurse
said when she came into work on Monday, March 20, 2023, she
saw a medical slip for Youth A to be seen due to a hurt ankle from
doing a cartwheel. Nurse said she did see Youth A but did not
examine her bare ankle. Nurse said Youth A had her ankle
wrapped in a brace and it appeared swollen, and Youth A said it
was “tender”. Nurse said Youth A said she was not having a lot of
pain and the Motrin was “working”. Nurse said she showed Youth
A how to use crutches but was not very coordinated and struggled
using them. Nurse said when Youth A was examined by Nurse
Practitioner an x-ray was ordered. Nurse said the need for an x-
ray was documented on the March 23, 2023, medical notes for
staff to complete. Nurse said when she arrived at work on
Monday, March 27, 2023, she learned the x-rays had not been
completed. Nurse said she discussed this with Supervisor D and
he followed through and got them completed on March 29, 2023.
Nurse said Youth A has had follow up appointments since her x-
rays and they have been completed in an appropriate timeframe.
Nurse Practitioner was interviewed via TEAMS at the facility,
on April 6, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Nurse Practitioner said she is employed with the Office of St.
4

Francis and is contracted to be at Bay Pines Center on Thursday’s
each week. Nurse Practitioner said she does make herself
available to answer messages throughout the week as she is able.
Nurse Practitioner said she was made aware of Youth A’s injury
when she came into clinic on Thursday, March 23, 2023. Nurse
Practitioner said she examined Youth A’s ankle which was
swollen, tender, and bruised. Nurse Practitioner said based on
what Youth A had reported hurting her ankle by landing a
cartwheel incorrectly, and the way the ankle looked Nurse
Practitioner thought it was a sprain but made the order for the x-
ray to be sure. Nurse Practitioner said she ordered an x-ray, said
that Youth A needed to continue to use the crutches she had at
the appointment, and remain non-weight bearing. Nurse
Practitioner said Youth A did not have any brace or wrap on her
ankle the day of the exam. Nurse Practitioner said she made the
order in the “EPIC” system to notify the hospital of the x-ray order
and then Nurse documents the need on the medical form for staff
to complete. Nurse Practitioner said she was notified by the EPIC
system that the x-ray had just been completed on March 29, 2023.
Nurse Practitioner said the message reported a fracture for Youth
A and so she contacted Nurse and had Youth A brought to the
Office of St. Francis to be seen by the sport medicine doctor and
get casted. Nurse Practitioner said she has never given Bay Pines
Center a specific timeframe for when x-rays need to be completed
however, she expected that anything she orders is completed in
24 to 72 hours.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on April 13,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he
was not working the day Youth A hurt her ankle. Staff 1 said he
came into work the day after Youth A hurt her ankle and noticed
she was limping and asked her what happened, and she told him
she landed wrong when doing a cartwheel. Staff 1 said he looked
at Youth A’s ankle and it was slightly swollen and bruised on the
inside and high on her ankle. Staff 1 said he provided Youth A
with ice, ibuprofen, and found her crutches to use. Staff 1 said
Youth A had “good range of motion” and was “walking around on
her foot”. Staff 1 said Youth A would use her crutches “part of the
time” due to being uncoordinated and having a difficult time
walking with them. Staff 1 said he thought Youth A’s ankle
appeared sprained however learned later she had a fracture. Staff
1 said he is not responsible for setting up medical appointments
for youth. Staff 1 said whenever a youth is injured the supervisors
are notified and they follow through on the medical process.
5

Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone, on April 10, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said has been a
Youth Aid since October 2021 and was working on March 19,
2023, with Youth A when she injured her ankle. Staff 2 said Youth
A was on the pod and attempted a cartwheel and landed wrong
and said, “ouch that hurt” and then walked to a chair and sat
down. Staff 2 said he called Supervisor D to the pod to look at
Youth A’s ankle. Staff 2 said a medical slip was completed for
Youth A to see Nurse Practitioner, and she was given ice and
ibuprofen due to her ankle starting to swell. Staff 2 said he logged
the injury in the communication book on the pod for other staff to
be aware of Youth A’s injury. Staff 2 said Youth A was walking on
her foot the remainder of the shift and did not complain of being in
pain. Staff 2 said he did not work again until March 22, 2023,
however, was not working directly with Youth A but did see she
was utilizing crutches to walk. Staff 2 said he was aware that
Youth A was going to see Nurse Practitioner as he helped her fill
out her medical slip but was not aware she needed x-rays as he is
not responsible to follow up on medical appointments. Staff 2 said
he was surprised to learn later that Youth A had fractured her
ankle as after the injury she was walking on it and not complaining
of being in pain.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on April 13,
2023. Staff 3 said he was previously a fill-in supervisor for about
three months. Staff 3 said he was trained by other supervisors that
it was supervisors’ responsibility to schedule staffing to take youth
to all their medical appointments. Staff 3 said Nurse provides
supervisors a medical calendar with all of the upcoming
appointments that need to be completed, supervisors hang it on a
clipboard in the supervisor office, supervisors set up staff
transportation to take youth to appointments, once completed the
supervisors highlight the appointment on the medical calendar so
that all other supervisors are aware the appointments are
completed. Staff 3 said all supervisors were aware of this process
and followed it to his knowledge.
Supervisor A was interviewed via telephone on April 20, 2023,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Supervisor A said he
has been a night supervisor since December 2003. Supervisor A
said he was not working when Youth A injured her foot.
Supervisor A said he came into shift and saw Youth A using
crutches and asked her what happened, and she reported to him
she hurt her foot and was getting an x-ray to see if it was broken.
Supervisor A said the youth see Nurse Practitioner on Thursday’s
during clinic hours. Supervisor A said after clinic Nurse provides
6

the supervisors a schedule of upcoming appointments that need
to be completed, then the supervisors all work on getting staff
coverage to take the youth to appointments on the list, and once
completed supervisors highlight the appointment. Supervisor A
said due to working the night shift he does not typically schedule
the staffing for these appointments as they are completed during
the day, so day supervisors tend to set up the appointments.
Supervisor A said x-rays should be done as soon as the “staff
have time”. Supervisor A said Youth A never asked him for ice or
ibuprofen. Supervisor A said many times Youth A refused to use
her crutches which was why the facility got her a wheelchair which
she has used more consistently.
Supervisor B was interviewed via telephone on April 13,2023,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Supervisor B said she
has been employed at Bay Pines Center for six and a half years
and is currently a supervisor. Supervisor B said her exact shifts
have changed periodically and has worked 7am to 7pm, 8am to
8pm, and 9pm to 9am. Supervisor B said when she was working
9pm to 9am she did assist with getting medical appointments set
up and completed however while on the other schedules she does
not assist as most appointments occur after 8am. Supervisor B
said youth go to clinic on Thursdays and afterwards Nurse will
provide supervisors medical notes with all the appointments that
need to be completed. Supervisor B said day supervisors are to
set up staff coverage to take youth to the appointments, once
completed they place the medical notes in a hanging folder for the
nurse and highlight the medical note sheet, so all supervisors are
aware that appointment has been completed. Supervisor B said
this process is well known to all supervisors at Bay Pines Center.
Supervisor B said she was not working when Youth A hurt her foot
however when she came in that evening, she saw crutches
outside of Youth A’s door and asked her what happened.
Supervisor B said Youth A told her she hurt her foot when she
was doing a cartwheel and that she had filled out a medical slip to
see the nurse. Supervisor B said she viewed Youth A’s ankle
through the bedroom window, and it appeared “slightly swollen but
not bruised”. Supervisor B said over the course of the next few
days she saw Youth A refuse to use her crutches and she
completed incident reports anytime she witnessed this. Supervisor
B said she never saw a clinic note that indicated Youth A needed
an x-ray however she works seven days on and then seven days
off so it may have been on a week that she did not work.
Supervisor C was interviewed via TEAMS at the facility, on
April 6, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
7

Supervisor C said he has been employed at Bay Pines Center for
twelve and half years and is currently a supervisor. Supervisor C
said he was not working with Youth A injured her ankle.
Supervisor C said when he came into work on Monday, March 20,
2023, he made rounds on the pods and Youth A told him she
injured her ankle. Supervisor C said at that time Youth A’s ankle
had no bruising and very little swelling and it appeared to him to
be a sprain and not a significant injury that needed immediate
medical attention. Supervisor C said Staff 1 asked him for
crutches for Youth A, so he found them and provided them to her.
Supervisor C said Youth A was using her crutches whenever he
saw her that day as well as Tuesday and Wednesday. Supervisor
C said he did not work on Thursday, March 23, 2023, but when he
came back into work on Friday, March 24, 2023, Youth A was no
longer using her crutches. Supervisor C said he reviewed the
Nurse medical form on Friday, and it indicated Youth A needed to
use her crutches until she had an x-ray and since she was no
longer on her crutches, he assumed she had already had the x-
ray completed. Supervisor C said he worked Saturday and
Sunday and Youth A did not use her crutches on those days either
and appeared to be looking “mostly normal” when walking as if
she “was recovering from a sprain”. Supervisor C denied asking
Youth A or any staff if the x-ray had been completed. Supervisor C
said when youth go to clinic, Nurse will complete medical notes
and they are sent out to supervisors, administration, and group
leaders. Supervisor C said Nurse will indicate on the medical form
if a youth has a medical appointment, however if medical need is
considered a high priority Nurse will come and tell the supervisor
on duty and it will be completed that day. Supervisor C said Youth
A would have seen Nurse Practitioner on Thursday when he was
off work, and he was unsure if it had been deemed high priority.
Supervisor C said there is no procedure in place to ensure items
of the medical notes are completed between supervisors.
Supervisor C said most supervisors try to communicate by
sending an email about items from their shift that needs to be
followed up on or communicated to the next shift. Supervisor C
said all supervisors set up medical appointments when they get
time, and he is not familiar with specific timeframes for
appointments but rather they do them “when they get staff and
time”.
Supervisor D was interviewed via TEAMS at the facility, on
April 6, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Supervisor D said he has been working at Bay Pines Center for
five and a half years and is currently a supervisor. Supervisor D
said he was working when Youth A hurt her ankle and he was
8

called down to her pod to talk with her. Supervisor D said Youth
A’s ankle was not swollen or bruised but she was complaining that
it hurt so he provided her with Motrin and ice. Supervisor D said
Youth A told him she was doing a cartwheel and “landed funny”.
Supervisor D said Youth A wrote a medical slip and he put it in the
medical box for her to be seen in clinic on Thursday. Supervisor D
said he was off work on Monday and Tuesday and when he came
back to work on Wednesday Youth A was using crutches.
Supervisor D said he did not work directly with Youth A that day
but did check in briefly with her and she did not complain of pain,
and he did not see her ankle that day. Supervisor D said Youth A
was then seen by Nurse Practitioner on Thursday and an x-ray
was ordered. Supervisor D said Nurse writes up clinic notes each
Thursday and provides a copy to the supervisor on duty, typically
around 4 or 5pm. Supervisor D said the same notes also get sent
out in a group email to supervisors and administration. Supervisor
D said when Nurse brought the notes that Thursday, she did not
specifically mention anything about Youth A’s need for immediate
x-rays. Supervisor D said he placed the notes on a clipboard in
the supervisor office, which is standard practice, for the
supervisors coming on shift the next few days to review and get
medical appointments completed. Supervisor D said due to getting
the clinic notes later in the day the medical appointments get
schedule and completed starting on Friday. Supervisor D said
once a medical appointment is completed the supervisor will
highlight it on the clinic notes on the clipboard, he noted this is
well known to all supervisors. Supervisor D said when he came
into work on Monday he reviewed the clinic notes and saw that
Youth A did not get her x-ray competed and so he doubled check
with Nurse and she confirmed in the system that they had not
been done and so he set up transportation for her to go on
Wednesday, March 29, 2203. Supervisor D said Youth A was
using one crutch whenever he saw her on Monday and Tuesday.
Supervisor D said he is not aware of specific timeframes to get x-
rays completed and that supervisors try to get everything on the
clinic notes completed within the week, so they are done by the
following clinic day.
Director was interviewed via telephone on March 30, 2023, via
TEAMS on April 6, 2023, and face-to-face at the facility on
April 13, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Director said Youth A had an x-ray ordered at medical clinic on
March 23, 2023, and was not taken in until March 29, 2023.
Director said Supervisor C failed to follow the procedure they have
in place and did not take Youth A in for her x-rays on March 24,
2023, as he was expected to. Director said all supervisors are
9

trained that x-rays and labs should be completed within 24 to 48
hours unless Nurse Practitioner says differently. Director
confirmed that this expectation has been reviewed with Supervisor
C. Director said the process for medical appointments is for Nurse
to provide a copy of clinic notes to the supervisor on duty the day
of clinic, those notes are placed on the clipboard in the supervisor
office, supervisors set up transportation and complete the medical
appointments, and then place medical documents in a medical
folder for nurse and highlight the appointment on the clinic notes
on the clipboard. Director said Supervisor C is well aware of this
process.
Documents Reviewed
• Incident Report 151380198 dated March 19, 2023. The
incident report documented Youth A injuring her ankle.
• Incident Report 151920201 dated March 31, 2023. The
incident report documented Youth A refusing to use her
crutches.
• Incident Report 151940203 dated April 1, 2023. The
incident report documented Youth A refusing to use her
crutches.
• Youth A’s safety plan dated March 29, 2023. The safety
plan documents Youth A’s broken tibia and the expectation
for staff to ensure she follows the medical directives. The
plan reviews how staff should support her in daily tasks and
that Youth A was given a wheelchair as she was struggling
with the crutches.
• Corrective Action Plan dated August 18, 2021, which
documents the current procedure for all x-rays. The
corrective action plan indicates all supervisors will be
provided medical notes with current appointments and it is
supervisor’s responsibility to have x-rays ordered by Nurse
Practitioner to be completed within 24 hours.
• A review of the general operating procedures was
reviewed. The facility does not currently have a procedure
in place that outlines who is responsible for the medical
appointments of youth or timeframes in which to have them
completed.
• Supervisor C’s personnel file: Supervisor C had one
disciplinary record dated August 15, 2017, for failure to
comply with policies for telephone usage, staff ethics, and
youth to staff ratio. There was no training record verification
that Supervisor C had been trained on the expectations for
supervisors to complete the medical appointments for
youth.
10

Video Review
Video footage of March 19, 2023, Youth A’s recreation pod
was reviewed on April 6, 2023. Youth A and several other youth
are seen in the middle of the recreational pod. Youth A is seen
doing a cartwheel and landing with her foot going inward and
falling to the floor. Youth A is seen getting up with help from
another youth and hopping to a chair and sitting down.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance with Health services,
policies and procedures. The facility has a corrective action place
dated August 26, 2021, that outlines the expectations for
supervisors to set up and follow through on all medical
appointments, specifically x-rays, however the general operating
procedure was not updated to reflect this expectation. Director,
Supervisor A, Supervisor B, and Supervisor D all reported the
expectations of supervisors to ensure youth’s medical
appointments are completed consistent with the corrective action
plan. Supervisor C failed to follow the expectation of having Youth
A's x-rays completed within 24-hours of being ordered.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2021C0128036 dated 7/14/2021, CAP Approved 8/26/21
SIR 2022C0114020 dated 2/9/2022, CAP Approved 4/8/22
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
